text: Tarun Gogoi (11 October 1934 - 23 November 2020) was an Indian politician. He was the Chief Minister of Assam from 2001 to 2016. He was a member of the Indian National Congress and led the party to a record three consecutive electoral victories in Assam. On 26 August 2020, Gogoi was hospitalized with COVID-19 and was given a blood plasma transplant in Guwahati, Assam. He died three months later on 23 November from problems caused by the infection, aged 86. ==References== Category:1934 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in India Category:Politicians from Assam Category:Indian National Congress politicians
title: Tarun Gogoi
